habitat_description:
The first report of this species is from Mt.Lyell at 3292 meters in elevation in Yosemite National Park (Camp 1916; Lannoo 2005). Later, individuals have been reported at Sonora Pass and to the south at Silliman Gap in Sequoia National Park (Adams 1942). More recently, isolated populations are known to occur at Smith Lake, in the Desolation Wilderness west of Lake Tahoe, and on the Sierra Buttes (Feder et al. 1982). Elevational range begins at 1200 meters at the base of Bridal Veil Falls in Yosemite National Park to about 3600 meters (Green et al. 2013).This species occurs in massive rock areas in mixed conifer, red fir, lodgepole pine, and
subalpine habitats. Elevation range extends from 1260 m (4130 ft.) to about 3640 m (11,940 ft.) (Jennings and
Hayes 1994)
